item.title: Comment on “The Simple Macroeconomics of AI” by LivelyClock
item.description:
Eh, I think I'm somewhere in the middle. Some industries will benefit more than others. Most will benefit incrementally over one or two decades.

The new good TC linked to is just more digital content. We weren't starving for that before LLMs came along.

There are products like self driving cars which would obviously be a big deal. When these come to maturity I expect swift adoption.

item.title: Comment on Saturday assorted links by M
item.description:
#5: According to the OWiD data the swift decline in income inequality in Mexico, if continuing on the same trend, would leave it lower than the United States by 2030.
Not really very good considering the low growth in general. (The metric linked, GDP per person employed, is actually falling in Mexico...) But an unexpected change about.
